results.title: The Pier
results.brief_description: Short film shot 1990 on Super 8 Film of St Kilda Pier (burnt down 2003). Filmed early in the morning, the moody feel of the work is heightened by atmospheric soundtrack (added by ACMI) Captures the shared experience of a morning spent at this popular spot for St Kilda residents.

results.title: The Great Sea Explorer
results.brief_description:
The story of Matthew Flinders and his journey to Australia. After leaving his family in England, Flinders sets off to sea, and after many years travelling to and around Australia, he returns home. His heroic journey is rewarded by the Queen with a house as a gift for his exploration achievements.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: A Day in the Life of Captain Cook
results.brief_description:
A reenactment of Captain Cook and his crew hitting land after a treacherous arrival to a new island, later named Botany Bay.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Mysteries of Ludwig Leicheart
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the historical journey across the Top End made by Ludwig Leicheart and his horse Rusty. They eat and sleep and upon waking, Leicheart gets attacked and killed by a dingo. Leicheart’s trusty horse avenges his master’s death by killing the dingo.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Modern Discoveries
results.brief_description:
A girl daydreams in class, thinking about people’s experiences of coming to Australia as well as her future desire to travel the world. Includes her thoughts about faraway societies.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Real Story of Captain Cook's Death
results.brief_description:
Captain Cook encounters new territory and claims it. He is attacked by a native of the island and so flees. The native gets subsequently eaten by a big fish.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Tripod donated by Daryl Annett.
results.brief_description: In 1951, this projector was brought to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia to entertain workers during the shearing season.

constellations_primary.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_primary.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

results.title_for_label: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.description: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. Situated on pastoral land in the Murray and Mellee region of South Australia, Koomooloo Station operated as a sheep station from 1868 and in 1951, this projector was bought to entertain workers during the shearing season. Luckily it has a vent at the back of the casing to keep it cool because if it was used inside a shearing shed the heat would’ve been insufferable.
description_for_label: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. Situated on pastoral land in the Murray and Mellee region of South Australia, Koomooloo Station operated as a sheep station from 1868 and in 1951, this projector was bought to entertain workers during the shearing season. Luckily it has a vent at the back of the casing to keep it cool because if it was used inside a shearing shed the heat would’ve been insufferable.
results.credit_line_for_label: ACMI Collection. Tripod donated by Daryl Annett.
